%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py

kustoDfDistributed  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "KustoAirlineDataParquetTransactional | where Year >= 1987	| take 10000") \
    .option("readMode", "ForceDistributedMode") \
    .load()

display(kustoDfDistributed)
**Create a set of random data with all the datatpes**

%%spark

import scala.util.Random
import java.time.Instant
import java.util.UUID

val aDynamic = s"""{"itemid":"X-Wing-${Random.nextInt()}" , "price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": ${Random.nextInt()}""" //s"""{"itemid":  , "in_stock": true,"price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": 23 }"""

val data = 1 to 100000 map(x =>  (Random.nextBoolean(), Instant.now().toString() , aDynamic ,UUID.randomUUID().toString() ,Random.nextInt(),Random.nextLong(),Random.nextDouble(),Random.nextString(5),123456789.12345678910d))

val allTypesDf = spark.sqlContext.createDataFrame(data).toDF("BoolType", "DateTimeType", "DynamicType","GuidType", "IntType", "LongType","RealType","StringType","DecimalType")
//(BoolType:bool,DateTimeType:datetime,DynamicType:dynamic,GuidType:guid,IntType:int,LongType:long,RealType:real,StringType:string,DecimalType:decimal)

allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource").option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster").option("kustoDatabase", "spark").option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesTransactionalSpark33").option("tableCreateOptions","CreateIfNotExist").mode("Append").save()
//allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource").option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster").option("kustoDatabase", "spark").option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesQueuedSpark33").option("tableCreateOptions","CreateIfNotExist").option("writeMode","Queued").mode("Append").save()
**This will not load immediately, but is a good test for the _queued_ mode**

%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
kustoDfAllTypes  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "KustoAirlineDataParquet | where Year >= 1987	 | take 100") \
    .option("readMode", "ForceDistributedMode") \
    .load()

display(kustoDfAllTypes)

%%pyspark

# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
transactionalModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "AllDataTypesTransactionalSpark33 | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(DateTimeType)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(transactionalModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py

    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "AllDataTypesQueuedSpark33 | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(DateTimeType)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(queuedModeCount)

# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py

    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "KustoAirlineDataParquetQueued | take 10000") \
    .option("readMode", "ForceDistributedMode") \
    .load()

%%spark

import scala.util.Random
import java.time.Instant
import java.util.UUID

val aDynamic = s"""{"itemid":"X-Wing-${Random.nextInt()}" , "price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": ${Random.nextInt()}""" //s"""{"itemid":  , "in_stock": true,"price": ${Random.nextInt()},"quantity": 23 }"""

val data = 1 to 100000 map(x =>  (Random.nextBoolean(), Instant.now().toString() , aDynamic ,UUID.randomUUID().toString() ,Random.nextInt(),Random.nextLong(),Random.nextDouble(),Random.nextString(5),123456789.12345678910d))

val allTypesDf = spark.sqlContext.createDataFrame(data).toDF("BoolType", "DateTimeType", "DynamicType","GuidType", "IntType", "LongType","RealType","StringType","DecimalType")
//(BoolType:bool,DateTimeType:datetime,DynamicType:dynamic,GuidType:guid,IntType:int,LongType:long,RealType:real,StringType:string,DecimalType:decimal)

allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource")
.option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesTransactionalSpark33")
.option("kustoCluster", "https://trdp-1665b5eybxs0tbett.z8.kusto.fabric.microsoft.com")
.option("kustoDatabase", "sdktests")
.option("tableCreateOptions","CreateIfNotExist")
.option("authToken",accessToken)
.mode("Append").save()
//allTypesDf.write.format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource").option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "FabricKustoLS").option("kustoDatabase", "Stocks").option("kustoTable", "AllDataTypesQueuedSpark33").option("tableCreateOptions","CreateIfNotExist").option("writeMode","Queued").mode("Append").save()

## Generate random streaming data : https://databrickslabs.github.io/dbldatagen/public_docs/using_streaming_data.html

import time
time_to_run = 180

from pyspark.sql.types import LongType, IntegerType, StringType

import dbldatagen as dg

device_population = 1000
data_rows = 1000 * 1000
partitions_requested = 8

country_codes = ['CN', 'US', 'FR', 'CA', 'IN', 'JM', 'IE', 'PK', 'GB', 'IL', 'AU', 'SG',
                 'ES', 'GE', 'MX', 'ET', 'SA', 'LB', 'NL']
country_weights = [1300, 365, 67, 38, 1300, 3, 7, 212, 67, 9, 25, 6, 47, 83, 126, 109, 58,
                   8, 17]

manufacturers = ['Delta corp', 'Xyzzy Inc.', 'Lakehouse Ltd', 'Acme Corp', 'Embanks Devices']

lines = ['delta', 'xyzzy', 'lakehouse', 'gadget', 'droid']

testDataSpec = (
    dg.DataGenerator(spark, name="device_data_set", rows=data_rows,
                     partitions=partitions_requested,
                     verbose=True)
    .withIdOutput()
    # we'll use hash of the base field to generate the ids to
    # avoid a simple incrementing sequence
    .withColumn("internal_device_id", LongType(), minValue=0x1000000000000,
                uniqueValues=device_population, omit=True, baseColumnType="hash")

    # note for format strings, we must use "%lx" not "%x" as the
    # underlying value is a long
    .withColumn("device_id", StringType(), format="0x%013x",
                baseColumn="internal_device_id")

    # the device / user attributes will be the same for the same device id
    # so lets use the internal device id as the base column for these attribute
    .withColumn("country", StringType(), values=country_codes,
                weights=country_weights, baseColumn="internal_device_id")
    .withColumn("manufacturer", StringType(), values=manufacturers,
                baseColumn="internal_device_id")

    # use omit = True if you don't want a column to appear in the final output
    # but just want to use it as part of generation of another column
    .withColumn("line", StringType(), values=lines, baseColumn="manufacturer",
                baseColumnType="hash", omit=True)
    .withColumn("model_ser", IntegerType(), minValue=1, maxValue=11,
                baseColumn="device_id", baseColumnType="hash", omit=True)

    .withColumn("model_line", StringType(), expr="concat(line, '#', model_ser)",
                baseColumn=["line", "model_ser"])
    .withColumn("event_type", StringType(),
                values=["activation", "deactivation", "plan change",
                        "telecoms activity", "internet activity", "device error"],
                random=True)
    .withColumn("event_ts", "timestamp", expr="now()")
    )

dfTestDataStreaming = testDataSpec.build(withStreaming=True, options={'rowsPerSecond': 1500})

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
transactionalModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "StreamIngestTest33Transactional | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(event_ts)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(transactionalModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
queuedModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "StreamIngestTest33Transactional | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(event_ts)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(queuedModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
functionModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("spark.synapse.linkedService", "sdktestcluster") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "spark") \
    .option("kustoQuery", "SparkTableIngestStats('StreamIngestTest33Queued')") \
    .load()

display(functionModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
queuedModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("kustoCluster", "https://trdp-1665b5eybxs0tbett.z8.kusto.fabric.microsoft.com") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "sdktests") \
    .option("authToken",access_token) \
    .option("kustoQuery", "StreamIngestTest33Transactional | project DiffSecs = datetime_diff('second',ingestion_time(),todatetime(event_ts)) | summarize  count(),min(DiffSecs),max(DiffSecs),avg(DiffSecs)") \
    .load()

display(queuedModeCount)

%%pyspark
# Read data from Azure Data Explorer table(s)
# Full Sample Code available at: https://github.com/Azure/azure-kusto-spark/blob/master/samples/src/main/python/SynapseSample.py
functionModeCount  = spark.read \
    .format("com.microsoft.kusto.spark.synapse.datasource") \
    .option("kustoCluster", "https://trdp-1665b5eybxs0tbett.z8.kusto.fabric.microsoft.com") \
    .option("kustoDatabase", "sdktests") \
    .option("authToken",access_token) \
    .option("kustoQuery", "SparkTableIngestStats('StreamIngestTest33Queued')") \
    .load()

display(functionModeCount)
